summary: An Extreme performance ENB with very eye friendly colors. For COT, RLO or ELFX, DD.
descriptionHtml:
[u][size=5]The important install instructions and other tweaking stuff below images, keep scrolling down till the end[/size][/u]


[size=5]New Updated Version!
VERY HIGH PERFORMANCE! WOOP WOOP![/size]


The following screenshots are obviously compressed jpeg images and in no way represent the actual in game awesomeness! They are merely to have a demo of what to expect...more or less. I hope you guys add screenshots, I'd love to see it in other setups.
[center]

[img]http://i.imgur.com/wxET6hQl.jpg[/img][/center]

Think of this ENB as the only performance ENB that is actually performing great! It reaaaaaaally annoys me when I see all those "performance presets" that waste so much needed fps for such small little changes. Performance means you have enough fps EVERYWHERE! From what I've seen, if you don't have a gtx 770 or higher forget about smooth gameplay, and expect to drop below 25 fps on certain areas. WELL NO MORE. THIS TIME YOU WILL PLAY SMOOTHLY. NO IFS and NO BUTS! But how you may ask!
[center]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/UEvgAFRl.jpg[/img][/center]

Well, instead of relying into ENB's fps heavy effects for eye candy, this ENB MOST IMPORTANTLY it utilizes [size=4][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/50638/?]Zeroking's Post Process Effects Add-on[/url] [/size]to add all the eye candy you see in the screenshots with minimal fps cost. The Second factor is the color palettes both in game and the default one. Everything that is even remotely fps heavy, had been replaced by those. EXCEPT DOF. DOF IS TOO GOOD TO LEAVE OUT.
[center]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/AQ5aj6Dl.jpg[/img][/center]

The result is a wonderful environment with the same beauty you'd expect from an ENB but with an extra 5fps than any performance version I have tried. On top of that it makes skin tone look so damn good looking you'd have to see it to know what I mean.
[center]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/loCsWjGl.png[/img][/center]

[u]PROS[/u]: Improved performance, beautiful graphics without too much in your face effects/colours, realistic and good looking skin tone. Leather looks like leather now and metal looks more like metal. Wood is also ehm....wooden.
[u]CONS[/u]: Many esps to have this (especially with RLO) but you can merge them now with the merge script mod, such realistic people, that you will cry at Kodlak's funeral everytiem and you will dump your RL girlfriend for Vilja.
[center]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/Tv85Kewl.jpg[/img][/center]
[u][size=4]
[size=5]Requirements:[/size][/size][/u][size=4]

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/50065/?]Natural Lighting and Atmospherics[/url] (only the .esp provided with the mod)
[size=4][size=4][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/30450/?]Realistic Lighting Overhaul[/url][/size][/size] or [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/27043/?]Enhanced Lights and FX
[/url][size=4][size=4][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/12454/?]Dark Dungeons for ENB[/url] (the darkest setting if you're a true Velvet guy/gal).
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/32269/?]Warmer Torch Lighting
[/url][/size][/size]Latest ENB from http://enbdev.com/mod_tesskyrim_v0264.html

Recommended but not required: [size=4][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/17802/?]Climates of Tamriel[/url] (weather patch and Supreme storms also compatible)
[/size]
[/size][size=5][size=4][u]INSTALL:

[/u]Download and install Natural Lighting and Atmospherics and take only the .esp and drop to your data folder.

Then install RLO or ElFx and their add-ons (including exteriors).

Then Dark Dungeons and even darker if you want.

Then Warmer torch lighting mod[size=5][size=4] and make sure they all are working properly. [/size][/size]

Disable Antialiasing and Anisotropic Filtering from Skyrim and Drivers

In Skyrimprefs.ini you should have: [size=5][size=4]fGamma=1.0000[/size][/size] , bFXAAEnabled=0 , bFloatPointRenderTarget=1, bTreesReceiveShadows=1, bDrawLandShadows=1, bShadowsOnGrass=1

Delete any previous enb and/or sweetfx folders or files you had and make sure you do it right (you can make sure by loading skyrim again)

Download the latest ENB binaries from the Link above, open the WrapperVersion folder and drag drop d3d9.dll and enbhost.exe into your MAIN Skyrim folder.

Download Velvet Enb and drag drop all the files from the Velvet Enb folder in your Skyrim folder too.

Open Enblocal.ini and change ReservedMemorySizeMb and VideoMemorySizeMb to the ones that are right for your system. See Troubleshooting below for more info.

Happy killings![/size]
[/size]
[center]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/tVy0Znpl.jpg[/img][/center]
[size=5] 
[size=4]MODS USED IN SCREENS/RECOMMENDED:
Vilja (Best Companion Ever!), Immersive Armors, Remodeled armor for CBBE Bodyslide, OCR for CBBE, AMIDIANBORN EVERYTHING! Skyrim Bigger Trees and Trees HD, Beautiful Whiterun, Frostfall, Alternative Start - Live another Life, Dramatic Clouds, Stunning Statues of Skyrim, Spicy Skyforge, Skyrim Flora Overhaul, Skyrim Beautiful Followers, W.A.T.E.R, Vivid Landscapes, Static Mesh Improvement Mod.[/size]

This ENB loves textures packs! It compliments a lot of mods here on the Nexus since it was tweaked in a world with around 100+ texture replacement mods. It's highly advised to use optimized 1k textures unless you have a very powerful card. Vanilla textures, especially on clouds, sky, water and grass will not look very great. The ENB's velvet nature especially compliments the purple-ish hue that is the signature of Amidianborn.


[size=4][u][size=5]Troubleshooting, F.A.Q.:[/size][/u]

[u]How do I make nights brighter/darker?[/u]

Increase/decrease AmbientLightingIntensityNight (in-game gui)

[u]How do I make days brighter?

[/u]Increase/decrease DirectLigthingDay and DirectlightingCurveDay (in-game gui)

[u]How do I set Enblocal.ini?[/u]

Set ReservedMemorySizeMb to half your graphics memory size. If you have a 1gb graphics card set to 512, etc. Then set AutodetectVideoMemorysizeMB=true and open skyrim. In game, open the GUI with Shift and Enter and look at the Memory window to see the right value and write it down. Then exit and set the AutodetectVideoMemorysizeMB=false and then put the number you saw in  VideoMemorySizeMb=.

[u]Too much FPS! ENB Vsync is off?[/u]

Enb Vsync is off. You can turn it on if you rely on ENB Vsync but Nvidia users should use Vsync from the Nvidia control panel. If for some reason, like mine, your control panel won't let you Vsync use the Nvdia inspector. Don't forget to disable Skyrim's Vsync from the ini files too if you use it either on ENB or Nvidia or you will lose FPS! To remove Skyrim Vsync you must set iPresentInterval=0 in Skyrimprefs.ini[/size].

[size=4][u]Can my [Insert outdated graphics card/PC] be able to play it?
[/u]If your CPU is an i5 and your graphics card is a gtx650ti or higher you will have no problems. The whole ENB was made so that I wouldn't drop below 30 fps in heavy areas since it really annoyed me when gaming.[/size]

[u]
CREDITS:[/u]

Boris Vorontsov - Creator of ENBSeries
Andrej Dudenhefner - Creator of SMAA injector
Christian Jensen - Creator of SweetFX
ZeroKing - Ported shaders to ENB
ManyGT - Sunsprite for ENB
Matso - Auto Focus Depth of Field
Sooner266 - Subsurface Settings for perfect skin tone
[/size]
